message_1: Let f(z) = z^2 + iz be a harmonic function defined on the interior of the unit circle |z|<1 in the complex plane. Find the real and imaginary parts of the value of this function at the point z=i/2.
message_2:
To find the value of the function f(z) at the point z = i/2, we simply plug in z = i/2 into the function:

f(i/2) = (i/2)^2 + i(i/2)

Simplify the expression:

f(i/2) = (-1/4) + (1/2)i

The real part of the value of the function at z = i/2 is -1/4, and the imaginary part is 1/2. So, f(i/2) = -1/4 + (1/2)i.
